item.title: 巴西红利风波后巴西国家石油公司投资者胜出
item.description: 关于巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）分红问题的拉锯战持续了七个星期，最终该公司向投资者派发了 220 亿雷亚尔（约合 43 亿美元）的红利。【原文：A seven-week tug of war over Petrobras’s dividends wound up with the company delivering a 22-billion-reais ($4.3 billion) payout to investors.】

item.title: 世界银行称商品成本高企影响降息前景
item.description: 世界银行表示，全球大宗商品价格的下跌正在稳定在仍然虚高的水平上，这可能会使各国央行无法迅速降息。【原文：The decline in global commodity prices is stabilizing at levels that are still inflated, which could keep central banks from cutting interest rates quickly, the World Bank said.】

item.title: 汉莎航空计划提高欧盟报价以挽救 3.25 亿欧元的 ITA 交易
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司（Deutsche Lufthansa AG）计划向意大利航空公司 ITA Airways 投资 3.25 亿欧元（3.48 亿美元），但此前的报价未能消除欧盟对竞争的担忧，预计德国汉莎航空公司将就该计划向欧盟监管机构提交新一轮让步。【原文：Deutsche Lufthansa AG is expected to submit a fresh round of concessions to European Union regulators over its planned €325 million ($348 million) investment in Italian carrier ITA Airways after an earlier offer failed to allay European Union competition concerns.】

item.title: 飞机零部件制造商 Loar 公司 3.08 亿美元首次公开募股后股价大涨 72
item.description: Loar Holdings Inc. 在首次公开募股中募集了 3.08 亿美元，发行价高于市场定价范围，该公司股价在首次交易中最高攀升了 72%。【原文：Loar Holdings Inc. shares climbed as much as 72% in its trading debut after the firm raised $308 million in an initial public offering that priced above a marketed range.】

item.title: 比尔-格罗斯称美国收益率飙升，坚持价值型股票，避开科技股
item.description: 周四，在一些令人担忧的美国经济数据公布后，国债和股市出现暴跌，比尔-格罗斯（Bill Gross）向投资者提出了一些建议："坚守价值型股票，暂时避开科技股"。【原文：Bill Gross offered some advice to investors as Treasuries and equities slumped Thursday after some worrisome US economic data: “Stick to value stocks, avoid tech for now.”】

item.title: Cathie Wood 的金融科技 ETF 去年回报 93% 后资产流失
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的散户大军整年都在 "擅离职守"--甚至在她表现最好的交易所交易基金中也是如此。【原文：Cathie Wood’s retail army has gone AWOL all year – even in her best-performing exchange-traded fund.】

item.title: 顶级可可种植商寻求避免价格上涨后出现出口违约
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，象牙海岸正努力避免可可出口违约潮，计划补偿托运人因支付给农民的价格意外上涨而造成的损失。【原文：Ivory Coast is seeking to avoid a wave of cocoa-export defaults with a plan to compensate shippers for losses caused by a surprise increase in the price paid to farmers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 空中客车公司提高 A350 速率，凸显对波音公司的优势
item.description: 空中客车公司（Airbus SE）将进一步提高其先进的A350宽体喷气式飞机的产量，因为该飞机制造商将受益于长途旅行需求的激增和主要竞争对手波音公司（Boeing Co.【原文：Airbus SE will further increase production of its advanced A350 widebody jet as the planemaker benefits from surging demand for long-distance travel and the crisis engulfing arch-rival Boeing Co.】

item.title: 阿根廷中央银行将关键利率降至 60
item.description: 阿根廷央行自哈维尔-米莱总统 12 月上任以来第四次下调关键利率，因为官员们押注南美国家的通胀将持续放缓。【原文：Argentina’s central bank cut its key interest rate for the fourth time since President Javier Milei took office in December as officials bet on a sustained slowdown in inflation in the South American nation.】

item.title: 散户自 11 月以来首次对股市持悲观态度
item.description: 个人投资者对美国股市在 4 月份跌跌不休后能否反弹持悲观态度，因为通胀仍然比预期的要严重，经济增长也停滞不前。【原文：Individual investors are pessimistic that the US stock market can bounce back after stumbling in April with inflation remaining stickier than expected and economic growth stalling.】

item.title: 贝莱德的比特币 ETF 巨头结束 71 天的资金流入热潮
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）的比特币基金在连续 71 天的时间里取得了骄人的业绩，在有史以来最大的交易所交易基金发行中积累了近 180 亿美元。现在，随着加密货币热度的减退，投资者已经停止涌入。【原文：For 71 days in a row, BlackRock Inc.’s Bitcoin fund enjoyed a remarkable run, amassing almost $18 billion in one of the biggest exchange-traded fund launches ever. Now, investors have stopped piling in as the crypto fever eases.】

item.title: 必和必拓为何在矿业巨额交易中瞄准英高集团

item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）在被问及她对日本为解决日元兑美元汇率下滑问题而可能采取的任何行动的反应时说，干预外汇市场的行为应该是罕见的。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said intervention in foreign-exchange markets should be rare, when asked for her reaction to any potential move by Japan to address the slide in the yen against the dollar.】

item.title: 本田斥资 110 亿美元在加拿大实施电动汽车战略
item.description: 本田汽车公司将斥资 150 亿加元（110 亿美元）在加拿大建立电动汽车供应链，政府将提供数十亿美元的财政援助，因为这家日本汽车制造商正努力开发该地区的长期需求。【原文：Honda Motor Co. will spend C$15 billion ($11 billion) to build out its electric-vehicle supply chain in Canada, with billions of dollars of financial aid from government, as the Japanese automaker seeks to tap long-term demand in the region.】

item.title: 私人信贷解决流动性问题的方案终于成型
item.description: 1.7 万亿美元私人信贷市场的爆炸式增长是有代价的，那就是投资者无法在资金紧张时退出所持股份。现在，一个可以让投资者解套的市场正在形成。【原文：Blow-out growth in the $1.7 trillion private credit market has come at a cost, namely investors’ inability to exit their holdings in a crunch. item.title: 印度批准俄罗斯公司投保海上保险

item.title: 购房者避开温哥华的新房地产，建筑商深受其害
item.description: 政客们迫切希望温哥华的开发商们建造更多的住宅，以缓解温哥华作为欧洲大陆最昂贵的房地产市场之一所面临的压力。问题只有一个，那就是没有足够的买家。【原文：Politicians are desperate for developers in Vancouver to build more homes to alleviate pressure in one of the continent’s most expensive real estate markets. There’s just one problem — not enough buyers are showing up.】

item.title: Permira 首席执行官认为私募股权基金将面临利率高企的洗牌
item.description: 私募股权投资行业正面临着一场清算；借贷成本居高不下，所投资公司的估值不断下降，投资者的要求也越来越高。但在 Permira 的顶头上司看来，情况还算不错。【原文：The private equity industry is facing a reckoning — with borrowing costs high, valuations for portfolio companies falling, and investors getting more demanding. But as far as Permira’s top boss is concerned, things are pretty good.】

item.title: 亚航计划以 14 亿美元合并新股上市
item.description: 亚航宣布了一项价值 68 亿林吉特（14.2 亿美元）的交易，以创建一个新的上市实体，通过合并旗下各航空公司部门来简化运营。【原文：AirAsia announced a 6.8 billion ringgit ($1.42 billion) deal to create a new, listed entity that will simplify its operations by combining its various airline units.】

item.title: 哈维尔-米莱掀起狂飙，比索跃居世界第一
item.description: 上任四个月以来，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊在这个长期饱受通货膨胀肆虐的国家完成了一项至关重要的壮举：他稳定了货币。【原文：Four months into office, Argentine President Javier Milei has pulled off a critical feat in a country long ravaged by runaway inflation: He stabilized the currency.】
